title: After a few minutes firefox cannot open new links (in new and current tabs)
content:
What happens is no matter how many tabs I open, after a few minutes I will not be able to open a link in any new tab. A short while later I cannot re-use the tabs where I did manage to open a link before - when I type or paste in a new link and press enter, or rcl+paste and go nothing happens - nothing gets loaded. In the "console" I see zero movement, same in the "network" tab of devtools.

I then close firefox and try to open a new instance. Often nothing will happen - when I go then to task manager I will see 4 instances of Firefox processes running and I have to kill 3 of them (the 4th disappears automatically after I "end task" the 3rd one).

Reinstalling does not help, disabling hardware acceleration does not help. Admittedly I do not experience this on my other machine (both Windows 10 and 11 - on yhis machine changing over to Win11 did not influence this).

What's interesting is it started some 6 months ago (I think), and the issue disappears shortly before the next update. Then I foolishly install the FF update, and the issue resurfaces.

I have no idea what's causing this but I hate it. I need help with this please.

title: URGENT: Firefox 40.0 for iOS is completely frozen and inaccessible
content:
Today I updated to Firefox 40.0 for iOS and its completely frozen every time I launch it.

Background:

I had over 200 tabs open when I upgraded. Every few days I sort through my open tabs and send those that I want to preserve to Pinboard. Although I am due to clean up tabs, this has never been a problem with previous Firefox upgrades.

In its current state Firefox is holding several important topics I was looking up hostage. I can’t just delete and reinstall the app because I don’t know that I will be able to find those pages again.

Expectation:

When I start Firefox for iOS I expect it to open the last tab I was on and allow me to interact with normal Firefox controls like entering the tab menu or typing in the URL bar.

Reality:

Everything is completely frozen. The most recent tab opens but it stuck with the purple loading bar 1/3 to 1/2 full. I cannot interact with any of the application controls such as opening menus or interacting with the URL bar. Firefox usually crashes to springboard after a minute or two if I wait for it to load.

I’ve tried 

- Force quit. This doesn’t change anything. - Phone restart.  When I restart my phone Firefox works for about 30 seconds but rapidly slows and freezes.  - Closing tabs.  I’ve restarted my phone and closes a few tabs until Firefox stops responding.  I’ve done this enough times to close about 40 tabs. It’s made virtually no impact.  - Other browser.  I’ve tested some of the same websites that are giving me trouble on Safari and they load quickly.  I do not appear to have connectivity issues nor do the websites that I am loading.  - Disabling external privacy features.  I use AdGuard Pro as well as NextDNS to improve privacy and speed when I browse.  I have disabled both services but it did not improve Firefox’s performance.

I’ve also noticed that, when I can get to the tabs pag, all the thumbnails have disappeared and been replaced with favicons. This suggests to me that perhaps Firefox emptied some kind of internal cache when it was upgraded. That said, historically if I clear the browsing cache with hundreds of tabs open I don’t have any sort of problem like this.

I will install screenshots in a follow-up to this post — I need to restart my phone to make them and I don’t want to lose what I’ve typed here. :-)

Final Thoughts: Firefox and Apple both encourage frequently updating apps. If Mozilla wishes to maintain a rapid update cycle it is critical that they do not introduce breaking changes. It is not reasonable for a user to “migrate” to a new version when they have (a) no means for rollback and (b) updates are either forced or hard to avoid.

Please help me resolve this so I can save the tabs that I need without information loss.
creator: j47

title: Accidently deleted 6 mo of bowser history on Firefox, Mac OS Bug Sur. How to recover that or at least the tabs and windows that were open
content:
I accidentally deleted 6 mo worth of Firefox browsing history (forgot to pick a specific url and instead deleted by month, sigh).

I did this (eg deleted an entire month in one click) looking to manually reopen tabs and windows I wanted back up. All this happened because Firefox had updated overnight and all windows and tabs vanished and no restore past session appeared. As a result I decided to just manually find them looking though old history, deleting stuff I didn't care about as I went. Bad move since after doing the current month I went to the next one and instead of choosing a specific url I just hit delete not realizing I was dumping the entire month. I repeated that until I noticed what I was doing when it only had left "older than 6 mo". I then closed Firefox and reopened and the restore only opened my searches for how to fix the problem (this was after deleting the 6 mo of history).

I am presuming because I deleted the history I can't just recover the tabs and windows (all I really care about, I'll live without some of the other history, other parts of the history I don't care about).

I googled first and can't figure out how to do what it says or how to find some of the files they tell you to find. I have not turned off my computer since doing this stupidity (saw not to do that trying to fix this for the last hour or so).

Any help appreciated!!! Thank you!

title: Does Firefox Desktop have a similar system to Collections in Firefox for Android?
content:
I always have a lot of tabs open, and could very easily streamline my work if I could group them into a system like Collections for Firefox Android. Bookmarks and Pocket do not make for easy working, especially when needing to revert to previous sites, and consequently the numerous tabs left open cause confusion and slow down the PC. Is there a similar system on Firefox for Desktop so I can group tabs/webpages/sites within Collections? Bookmarks and Pocket do not work in the same way and are very clumsy and cumbersome in comparison.

Microsoft Edge has its own Collections system, and if Firefox has nothing compatible, I am seriously considering leaving Firefox and reverting back to Edge, although I would be risking my privacy and security which I value so highly with Firefox.

Any suggestions please?

title: Constant crashes even after Cleanup or Reinstallation
content:
Since a few days, I keep experiencing constant crashes with Firefox.

In the most common way, a Tab will crash first, often followed shortly by the whole browser crashing.

Crashes occur on, but are not limited to, following pages: • YouTube.com • Reddit.com • Google Account Login • about:preferences • about:crashes • about:support • The very same Support-page I’m writing this on

Crashes still occur after: • Rebooting Computer • Clearing of Cache • Starting in Safe Mode (crashes in Safe mode) • Deactivation of hardware acceleration • Refreshing Firefox • Reinstallation of Firefox (Uninstalled with the Uninstall/helper.exe) • Use of Windows Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool (DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth)

Crash logs list: • Crash Reason EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT Crash Address 0x00007ff88082381f • Crash Reason EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ Crash Address 0x000001f4465fffe8

I’m kind of out of options. Most support pages are 2 years or older, so I don’t really know if I’m experiencing the same errors as they did.

If there’s any more information required, please let me know.
creator: dario10

title: Riconsentire a un sito di inviare messaggi di conferma di modifica
content:
Buongiorno,

qualche giorno fa ero su un sito, uno dei tanti per la compilazione delle fatture, e ne stavo modificando una. Mi serviva eliminare alcune righe della fattura e ogni volta il sito mi chiedeva, tramite una sorta di notifica push, "Sei sicuro di voler eliminare la riga in questione" e ogni volta davo l'OK. In ognuno di questi messaggi mozilla mi dava la possibilità di selezione anche "blocca l'invio di messaggi di conferma da questo sito" o qualcosa del genere. Per sbaglio durante la comparsa di una di queste notifiche, invece di dare l'OK alla modifica della fattura, ho dato l'OK al blocco di questa tipologia di messaggi da questo sito. Morale della favola: non riesco più a modificare nulla quando lavoro su questo sito, perchè, ad esempio, clicco sulla cancellazione della riga della fattura, ma non succede nulla, dovrebbe comparire questa notifica di conferma che io però ho bloccato, e tutto rimane fermo.

Qualcuno saprebbe indicarmi una soluzione? Smanettando con le impostazioni delle notifiche push potrei risolvere? (Purtroppo adesso sono a casa e il problema ce l'ho col pc al lavoro, dove comunque utilizzo sempre mozilla aggiornato all'ultima versione, quindi non riesco a fare tentativi "live" al momento, dovrò aspettare sino a lunedì)

Grazie in anticipo e buona giornata
creator: GP84

title: Tálca ikon
content:
Tisztelt Support!

A böngésző frissítése óta a tálcára rögzített Firefox ikon nem jelenik meg. Helyette egy fehér szögletes (mint egy lap) ikont látok. Azóta próbáltam: kikapcsolni a gépet és újraindítani, levenni a tálcáról és újra kitűzni az ikont. A helyzet változatlan. Kérném segítségét a megoldáshoz.

Köszönöm, Őszy Zsófia

title: Why isn't the file name you want to save something as 'automatically highlighted' like it used to be?
content:
Just got a new 14 inch macbook pro. When I go to save something, via control+click, when the "window showing the name the file shall be saved as" appears, it no longer 'automatically' highlights the given name the file already has. You have to do command+tab three separate times for it do it, or you have to manually drag the cursor to said bar every single time you want to download or save anything. Wasn't the old way, where it was automatically highlighted, way less tedious? All you had to do was option+click, type something, and poof. Now you have to option+click, move the cursor to a precise spot, click, then press the up arrow, and THEN type something and poof. Or option+click command+tab Tab Tab, THEN type something and again, poof.

Is there a way to tell it to automatically START with it highlighted, or in any of other five options that cycle through when you do press command+tab five times? there should be.

title: Firefox for linux: what's the difference between ~/.cache/mozilla/firefox/ and ~/.mozilla/firefox/.../storage/default/{url}/cache/
content:
I am trying to figure out what does not need to be included in my `rsync` backups. I noticed two apparent types of cache directories:

Many files following this format, as as example. ``` ~/.mozilla/firefox/...default-release/storage/default/https+++[URL]/cache/morgue/217/{2f9...d9}.final ``` and ``` ~/.cache/mozilla/firefox/...default-release/ ``` The latter contains sub-directories and a file `activity-stream.discovery_stream.json`.

Why are there these two different formats for caches? Which one or both can I exclude from backups?
